name: kite
description: Python programming copilot â€” Kite shows cloud-powered completions, documentation, and examples.

showKiteTourOnStatup.description: Whether to display the Kite tour on startup.

enableCompletions.title: Enable Completions
enableCompletions.description: Show auto-completions from Kite as Atom suggestions

enableHoverUI.title: Enable Hover UI
enableHoverUI.description: Show hover informations when placing the mouse over a symbol

displayExpandViewAs.description: This setting defines how the Kite expanded view will be displayed in Atom.

sidebarPosition.description: When `Display Expand View As` is set to `sidebar` this setting defines where to place the sidebar in the Atom UI.

sidebarWidth.description: When `Display Expand View As` is set to `sidebar` this setting defines the width of the sidebar.

openSidebarOnStartup.description: When `Display Expand View As` is set to `sidebar` this setting will make the sidebar appears on startup.

hideDocumentationWhenSignatureIsAvailabl.description: If both a signature and documentation is available at the same only the signature will be visible.

loggingLevel.description: The verbosity level of Kite's logs.

developerMode.description: Enable Kite developer mode, displaying received data in the various UIs.

readme:
Kite for Atom
=============

Kite gives you completions and documentation in Atom, sorted by popularity.

We'll be adding many more features very soon.

You can learn more about the broader Kite product at <http://kite.com>.  As part of this package, you also get the Kite Sidebar, which shows more information as you're working.  You can access the Kite Sidebar by launching Kite in your Applications folder.
